subject: Gardening
title: Guerrilla Gardens of Havana
description: A quick, practical guide to Guerrilla Gardens of Havana.

hook.text: When the Soviet Union collapsed, Cuba lost 80% of its food imports overnight. Gardens saved the nation.

buildup.text: The 'Special Period' of the 1990s brought near-famine. Cubans converted every vacant lot into urban farms.

discovery.text: Havana alone developed over 30,000 urban gardens called organoponicosâ€”raised-bed farms on concrete and rubble.

twist.text: Without access to chemical inputs, Cuba's urban farms became organic by necessityâ€”not ideology.

climax.text: Cuba's crisis created the world's most successful urban agriculture system. Gardens became a survival strategy.

punchline.text: A food crisis turned Havana into a giant garden.

quiz.question: Why did Cuba develop extensive urban farming in the 1990s?
options: The government launched a planned agricultural reform program
The collapse of the Soviet Union cut off 80% of Cuba's food imports
A hurricane destroyed all of Cuba's rural farmland
